availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Edwards (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer, prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married Margaret Cary Edwards in Christian County on June 10, 1841. Father of Mary E. Edwards, James H. Edwards, Samuel R. Edwards, Infant Edwards, Milton S. Edwards, Ofelia B. Edwards, and Everett C. Edwards. Farmer in Christian County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860. Member of the provisional government convention in Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 5 of 5 on microfilm (access via Ancestry.com).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 1, p. 360B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, 1818-1887, Film #001942963, p. 445.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989_, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Madison County Administrator Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975 (Accessed through ancestry.com on November 15, 2019), p. 413 of microfilm.
